Turntable83: The people who spend insane amounts of money on the best PC hardware available for playing games are complete morons.

You don't have to waste money like that to have a good gaming PC, though. I bought a Geforce 9800GT about 3 years ago, a little over $100. I am still using it, and playing the latest games smoothly. Some of them I need to run at 1280x720 instead of 1920x1080 if it gets a little choppy, but it still looks better than a 360 or a PS3 at 1920x1080.

The console releases have toned down graphics so the games can still run smoothly on hardware from like 2005. PC releases have superior controls too, especially in FPS or this person shooter games.

I've got Hitman Absolution on PC, i rented the 360 version from a Redbox just to compare. It was terrible. Console controllers just don't let you get even remotely as accurate as keyboard and mouse. That's why console ports have heavy aim assist to make it playable.

Consoles can be more convenient, and they do the job but be realistic. You sound as bad as the elitist PC fanboys that you're talking shit about.
Oh, also THIS GAME FUCKING SUCKS PEOPLE!! RUN FOR YOUR LIVES!!!!!
